messages.text: I see there is some sort of confusion regarding the subscribable add-on. So I'll try to explain everything thoroughly in :thread:
messages.raw_text: I see there is some sort of confusion regarding the subscribable add-on. So I'll try to explain everything thoroughly in :thread:

thread_replies.text:
*Context:*
There are two separate topics regarding subscribable addons:
• Brands that provide subscribable add-ons to their users: Factor, GoodChop, ThePetsTable
• Brands that are communicating with email any changes to those subscribed add-ons, due to legal requirements: Factor, ThePetsTable
Both Factor and TPT were using https://github.com/hellofresh/subscribable-addons-bff to generate an event for sending email from the web client:
```Web -> BFF -> Salesforce -> CRM team uses the event to send the email```
With the new approach developer in NV-CRM, we generate these events without web client involvement. It's enabled for Factor, TPT and Hellofresh US
```Web -> MSS (directly or via BFF) -> Kafka events -> NV-CRM -> Salesforce -> CRM team uses the event to send the email```

*How did we rollout?*
We are sending two different events to Salesforce, and CRM team decides which one to use for triggering the email:
• BFF: `addons_subscription_staging` and `addons_subscription`
• NV-CRM: `addon_subscription_change_staging` and `addon_subscription_change` 
We decided to go with this approach to avoid migrating multiple clients at the same time. Also *both solution can coexists* and don't interfere with each other

*Current status (AFAIK)*
CRM team completely migrated "Factor" emails to the NV-CRM events. They are not using the events from the BFF anymore
For TPT, staging emails are migrated to use NV-CRM events. I'm not sure if the live emails are also migrated

As soon as CRM team change the trigger on their side, web clients can use MSS directly instead of calling MSS

Also
> Why Hellofresh US is enabled on NV-CRM?
Initially when I started working on the feature, I also though US is one of the brands that we need to support. It's https://github.com/hellofresh/nv-crm-events-service/blob/5fbbf68557496d537139feda3d3ee047f8cb0838/shared/src/main/kotlin/com/hellofresh/nv/crm/divisions/Groups.kt#L7-L9 on NV-CRM (So we are generating the events for US). But it's not used at all

> GoodChop also using https://github.com/hellofresh/subscribable-addons-bff, why we are not supporting it?
GoodChop never started the work on the Salesforce and never configured the https://github.com/hellofresh/subscribable-addons-bff/blob/567c65d363ca94c43bcbdf7c44a350e42d2d2ff5/src/libs/config/index.ts#L7
For onboarding GoodChop, there's a doc in NV-CRM: https://github.com/hellofresh/nv-crm-events-service/blob/master/docs/onboarding%20a%20new%20brand.md

I'm aligned here but just to be extra clear, GoC isn't using the subscribable add-ons CRM event but they are still using the subscribable-addons-bff on the FE, meaning they also need to make sure they're not calling it anymore before we deprecate this service.

There's a possibility that all the instances where GoC is using the BFF are shared code with the rest of the WL, so maybe doing the FE changes for TPT and VMS would be enough to also handle GoC but I'm not 100% sure so I think it's worth having them check

> meaning they also need to make sure they're not calling it anymore before we deprecate this service
Yep. But also the BFF is called by other clients: https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C09DP0G2YP9/p1759328571164999?thread_ts=1759158924.098169&cid=C09DP0G2YP9

Thanks for summary Mori!
I believe TPT started using NV-CRM events in live. @US74TEQ3E https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C05C4G5D3B8/p1765466373315359?thread_ts=1758027138.507279&cid=C05C4G5D3B8 yesterday @U8F7ZDAPM. @U047SAC2PPV ask was to migrate to new dex have we asked CRM to update the emails as well?

Agreed with Ahmed we need to make sure that all clients stop calling subscribable-addons-bff service before we sunset the service.
Note:
• I will follow up with GoC about the next steps.
• Will follow up to see where we are with YouFoodz migration to new app.
• FYI Programs are also going to be "killed" we are migrating customers now. This topic is on hold for now. 
Thanks all!

> ask was to migrate to new dex have we asked CRM to update the emails as well
not sure if I understand your question. When CRM migrates to a new dex, it means they are using it for the emails

> I'm not sure if the live emails are also migrated
I got confused with this I thought there is additional ask for them to update emails, but if not all good.

thread_replies.text: @U2D54V0UV please remove this integration. We should not have this in the public channel
I don't have permissions sadly. I don't see this as problem though. Also I don't have access to Jira project to remove the MIO project integration from the app. So need your help :smile:
I found it yesterday and removed it https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C09NKC5J2GL/p1765830026136259
You did it from Jira, yeah you can silence it or remove it or adjust notifications to private if you want. Now the Jira cloud app is also removed.

messages.text:
Regarding the new-ventures-bff, I added all of the tickets in TPT board: https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/TPT-2336

These tickets only cover the Phase 1 of the https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TNV/pages/5643894810/Pet+Food+BFF+Architecture+and+Implementation+Strategy. For the second phase, you can can create same set of tickets as needed (I didn't create anything since it depends on how the first phase is gonna look like)

I also added Labels:
• `nv-bff`: Tickets related to BFF work. to be able to distinguish them on the Kanban/Sprint boards
• `mio-dep`: Tickets that need direct contribution from a Backend engineer (e.g. deployment, OAM manifest, Grafana dashboards ...)
• `not-blocker`: Nice to have features that are not a blocker for the Rollout
cc @U8F7ZDAPM @U2D54V0UV
messages.raw_text:

cc <@U8F7ZDAPM> <@U2D54V0UV>
